page.title: 15LANDSCAPE AND BUILDINGS.
page.content: {Lanscape. }The soil is clay, subsoil clay and marl with outcrops of TIlestone and Cornstone. The landscape is thus undulating with many small streams forming small valleys some with steep inclines.Small copses, isolated old oaks and orchards stil syrvive to provide varied scenes. {Buildings.}Several Farmhouses, cottages and barns are Listed Buildings ( mainly late 17th. or early 18th. century.)They have walls of local Sandstone, some with Timber Frames and rooves of stone tiles or slates. Internally there is much exposed oak and some particularly fine old Staircases.Later and more Contemporary buildings are mostly brick built with slate or tile rooves. Many modern farmbuildings have steel/ concrete frames, concrete walls,metal or wooden cladding and asbestos rooves
